name: Andor Polgar
introduction: I built my first website when I was 12 years old. I figured out HTML by experimenting and chagning the source code of other websites on the internet. My first big project was to take over the maintenance of my school's website when I was 14 years old. As a kid, I always wanted to be an embedded system developer, but to pay my tutiton and my living costs in Budapest, I had to start building websites for money. That's how I end up in the industry.

positions.description: I joined Docler in 2013 as a TV & Mobile Frontend Developer in Budapest. Since that time, I have worked in the Luxembourg, Los Angeles and now Amsterdam offices in progressively higher roles. They trusted me with deployment rights for their multi-billion dollar streaming platform. I'm currently helping to establish the mobile development team here in the Amsterdam branch, interviewing senior front-end developers, mentoring newcomers and looking for potential team members who are willing to help us with rebuilding the mobile web application of LiveJasmin.
I was helping to establish a strong front-end team in the overseas branch of the company.
I was working on rebuilding the mobile web application for LiveJasmin, which is the company's flagship product.
I was assigned to maintain the mobile web application of LiveJasmin, which is the company's flagship product.
